snippet: The federal program providing insurance to noninterest-bearing bank accounts might be eliminated after Republicans opposed a measure to extend it for another two years.
abstract: Senate fails to clear bill that would have extended for two more years program that provided federal insurance for deposits kept in no-interest accounts at federally insured banks; measure was supported by small banks and White House, but opposed by larger banks and credit unions.
lead_paragraph: The federal program providing insurance to noninterest-bearing bank accounts might be eliminated after Republicans opposed a measure to extend it for another two years.

headline.seo: Deposit Insurance Bill Is Stopped in the Senate
headline.main: Deposit Insurance Bill Is Blocked in the Senate
headline.print_headline: Deposit Insurance Bill Is Blocked in the Senate
